name: Hardest "The Dresden Files" - "Boone Identity" Trivia Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was stolen from the antique store?
questions.explanation:
Stone tablet.

	The thief dropped the tablet as he was leaving the store and broke it. He was later killed the same night when his shotgun went off during a struggle.

Gus Boone.

	While interviewing the shop owner Dresden had a flashback and saw Boone kill the shop owner's daughter. The ghost knocked Dresden over during his vision.

questions.text: The item that was stolen from the store allegedly had belonged to an Egyptian God. Which one?
questions.explanation:
Anubis.

	The item was a stone tablet called the Lock of Anubis. Anubis was the God of the dead. Anubis is the Greek name for him. As an Egyptian he was known as Anpu.  The episode referred to the artifact as Egyptian, and the God as well, but used his Greek name throughout. It wasn't explained why, though it's likely because viewers were more apt to know Anubis than Anpu.

questions.text: Harry sought the help of a shaman to help him track the ghost he was seeking.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Completely made up, but it sounds like something he would have done had done. Instead he sought the help of wealthy Chicago business man Edward Miller, who just happened to collect Egyptian artifacts.

questions.text: What happened to Lt. Murphy in Dresden's apartment?
options: An errant spell knocked her out.
She fell asleep and crossed over to another dimension.
A bullet struck her in the leg.
questions.explanation:
She cut her hand.

	She went to leave, after yelling at Dresden for investigating a closed case, but couldn't quite get out before she was injured. She grabbed the door handle and cut open her finger when it didn't turn.

questions.text: Who did Harry visit in prison?
questions.explanation:
Lucas Sabin.

	Sabin's former cellmate was Gus Boone. Dresden was trying to figure out why Sabin had tried to buy the same item that Boone stole from the antique store. What he did find out is that Sabin had the same tattoo as Edward Miller.

questions.text: Lt. Murphy shot and killed Dresden, but he was brought back when Bob performed a spell later in the episode.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Murphy, who was being possessed by Gus Boone at the time, fired two shots into Dresden and then left the house they were at. Harry however was saved by a protection bracelet he had inherited from his mother.

questions.text: Dresden made a voodoo doll of whom?
questions.explanation:
Connie Murphy.

	A voodoo doll is black magic, something Harry wasn't supposed to dabble in. Bob did manage to convince Harry not to use the doll, for a short time. He used blood left on the door handle earlier in the episode to make it work. He used the doll to get Boone, in Murphy's body, to come to him.

questions.text: What was the name of the prison where Boone had served time?
options: Los Angeles Home for the Criminally Insane
questions.explanation:
Menard Correctional Facility.

	That is where Sabin and Boone met. Sabin had convinced Boone to steal the tablet, and use it to break him out of prison. After Boone took the tablet, and broke it, he double crossed Sabin and left him in prison.

questions.text: How did Harry stop the murderer in the end?
questions.explanation:
Rebuilt the broken tablet.

	He used the Lock of Anubis, after reconstructing it, to remove Boone's ability to jump bodies. He had to basically use the inverse pattern of what Boone had done to take back the ability.
